original_title: Giving a Tinge of Color to the Mars Map Courtesy of the UAE’s Hope Orbiter
original_content:
Since the United Arab Emirates Hope (Al-Amal) orbiter made it safely into orbit around Mars on February 9, 2021, its been busy using its onboard instruments to measure everything it could about not only the planets atmosphere but also its surface and how both change seasonally. The first months of results of these detailed captures of Mars have now been released in the form of the full-color Mars Atlas website, and a pretty well made PDF version of the Atlas that can be downloaded from the website.
Although the Emirates Mars Mission is not the first to capture the surface or seasons of Mars  with the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter (MRO)s Context Camera  (CTX) having gifted us the result of many thousands of captures in a massive monochrome mosaic of Mars surface  its good to remember that Hope is only just getting started. The current atlas is the result of about 3,000 captures from the Emirates eXploration Imager (EXI) multi-band camera (with better than 8 km spatial resolution), with new images in the pipeline.
Hope has transitioned from a low 1,072 km orbit to a higher, science orbit on March 29, which gives the orbiter a good view of the seasonal transitions on the Red Planet. Along with data from other current Mars orbiters, we should be able to piece together the most detailed atlas yet, even before more helicopters will zip along Mars surface.
title: アラブ首長国連邦の火星オービターが火星の大気や表面を計測
body: アラブ首長国連邦の「Hope (Al-Amal)」探査機が、2021年2月9日に火星の軌道に到達して以来、火星の大気、地表、季節的な変化などを詳細に計測しています。探査機が取得した最初の成果は、フルカラーの「Mars Atlas」ウェブサイトと、ウェブサイトからダウンロードできるPDF版で公開されています。これにより、火星の最も詳細な地図が作成される予定です。
